movies.title: Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté
movies.plot: On a cloudy day, in a small town, a carnival is going on. There's singing and dancing, kids with their bicycles storming up and down the road, families with their kids watching the games. Next to a big carousel, a three-year-old boy, is watching the activities from a distance, unattended and with a small note on his hand, crying inconsolably. The man operating the machine, observes the sad scene and asks the boy of the whereabouts of his mother and the content of the note. It seems that the poor boy, abandoned by his mother, has nowhere to go. From that point on, the boy will become part of a travelling circus and start a career as an intrepid trapeze acrobat. The boy will leave the circus and become a man, starting his own business, ultimately reaching the peak by being the biggest in his trade. Accomplished, married and divorced, with kids, wealth and recognition, will one day quit the firm and his current lifestyle, to set out on a solitary voyage of self-awareness, crossing the ...
movies.simplePlot: A successful entrepreneur in his fifties will decide to abandon his loved ones and the empire he has built, just to find the liberty he has been seeking, not knowing that the itinerary of one's life often changes in the funniest of ways.

biography.bio: The son of the renowned French sculptor Paul Belmondo, he studied at Conservatoire National Superieur d'Art Dramatique (CNSAD); after the minor stage performances he made his screen debut in À pied, à cheval et en voiture (1957) but the episodes with his participation were cut before release. However, the breakthrough role in Jean-Luc Godard's Breathless (1960) made him one of the key figures in the French New Wave. Since mid-60s he completely switched to commercial mainstream pictures and became a big comedy and action star in France. Following the example of Alain Delon he founded his own production company Cerito named after his grandmother's maiden name. In 1989 he was awarded Cesar for his performance in Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988) . Recently he returned to stage performing in the Theatre Marigny in Paris. He still appears in the movies but not so often as before preferring mostly dramatic roles. The president of France distinguished him with order of Legion of Honour. Belmondo has daughter Florence and son Paul. His elder daughter Patricia died in a fire in 1994. None of his children became actors though you could have seen his son Paul in the episodic role in Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988).
biography.name: Jean-Paul Belmondo

biography.bio: Richard Anconina was born on January 28, 1953 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for La vérité si je mens! (1997), Tchao pantin (1983) and Le petit criminel (1990).
biography.name: Richard Anconina

biography.bio: Lio was born on June 17, 1962 in Mangualde, Portugal as Wanda Ribeiro de Vasconcelos. She is an actress, known for Des jeunes gens mödernes (2011), La madre muerta (1993) and Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988).
biography.name: Lio

biography.bio: Béatrice Agenin was born on July 30, 1950 in Paris, France. She is an actress, known for Une famille formidable (1992), Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988) and Michel Vaillant (2003).
biography.name: Béatrice Agenin

biography.bio: Marie-Sophie L. was born on February 14, 1963 in Paris, France as Marie-Sophie Pochat. She is an actress, known for Tout ça... pour ça! (1993), Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988) and Attention bandits! (1986). She was previously married to Claude Lelouch.
biography.name: Marie-Sophie L.

biography.bio: Jean-Philippe Chatrier was born in 1956 in France. He was an actor and writer, known for Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988), Hommes, femmes, mode d'emploi (1996) and Les misérables (1995). He died on July 6, 2010 in France.
biography.name: Jean-Philippe Chatrier

biography.placeOfBirth: Trebnitz, Silesia, Germany [now Trzebnica, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Gila von Weitershausen was born on March 21, 1944 in Trebnitz, Silesia, Germany as Gisela Freiin von Weitershausen. She is an actress, known for The Country Doctor (1987), Murmur of the Heart (1971) and Die Lümmel von der ersten Bank - 1. Trimester: Zur Hölle mit den Paukern (1968). She has been married to Dr. Hartmut Wahle since 1994. She was previously married to Martin Lüttge.
biography.name: Gila von Weitershausen

biography.bio: Michel Beaune was born on December 13, 1933 in Paris, France as Michel Louis Bosne. He was an actor, known for The Professional (1981), Coup de torchon (1981) and Get Out Your Handkerchiefs (1978). He died on July 24, 1990 in Clichy, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Michel Beaune

biography.bio: Pierre Vernier was born on May 25, 1931 in Saint-Jean-d'Angély, Charente-Maritime, France as Pierre Rayer. He is an actor, known for Under the Sand (2000), Le Chef (2012) and Adieu De Gaulle adieu (2009).
biography.name: Pierre Vernier

biography.bio: Philippe Lorin is an actor, known for Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988) and Il y a des jours... et des lunes (1990).
biography.name: Philippe Lorin

biography.bio: Annie Philippe was born on December 17, 1946 in Paris, France. She is an actress, known for Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988), Juste un peu de réconfort... (2004) and Rendezvous am Rhein (1964).
biography.name: Annie Philippe

biography.bio: Céline Caussimon is an actress, known for Le Chef (2012), Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988) and Elle s'appelait Sarah (2010).
biography.name: Céline Caussimon

biography.bio: Gallic lead and character actor Daniel Gelin did not have an easy life but was warmly embraced as a talented star who appeared to fine advantage for such legendary directors as Max Ophüls, Louis Malle, Jean Cocteau, Alfred Hitchcock, and Claude Lelouch. He left home at age 16 to take dramatic arts classes under the guidance of Louis Jouvet. After a long apprenticeship in extra films parts beginning in 1941, he finally earned leading roles in 1949 and went on to mesmerize audiences in such films as Rendez-vous de juillet (1949), Le Plaisir (1952), Napoleon (1955), The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956), Testament of Orpheus (1960) and many more. It's generally considered, however, that he squandered his talent and could have accomplished much more. His personal life was a mess. The turbulent Gelin lived a highrollercoaster life with stormy relationships that led to suicide attempts and a long battle with alcohol and drugs. One son, Pascal Gelin, died at the age of 14 months when he accidentally swallowed pills in 1957. In 1999, another son, Xavier Gélin, lost his battle with cancer. He was married three times. His daughter, actress Maria Schneider, however, was the product of his liasion with French model Christine Marie Schneider, whom he never married.
biography.name: Daniel Gélin

biography.bio: Alexis Gruss is an actor and writer, known for Empreintes (2007), Vivement dimanche (1998) and Thé ou café (1996).
biography.name: Alexis Gruss

biography.bio: Nicolas Mallet is an actor, known for Itinéraire d'un enfant gâté (1988).
biography.name: Nicolas Mallet
